metadata.name: Potential File Extension Spoofing Using Right-to-Left Override
metadata.comment: Detects suspicious filenames that contain a right-to-left override character and a potentially spoofed file extensions.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('3') AND contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\u202e')) AND (contains(lower(file.path), lower('fpd..')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('nls..')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('vsc..')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('xcod.')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('xslx.'))))

output.summary: Detects suspicious filenames that contain a right-to-left override character and a potentially spoofed file extensions.

metadata.objective: False positive: Filenames that contains scriptures such as arabic or hebrew might make use of this character References: https://redcanary.com/blog/right-to-left-override/, https://www.malwarebytes.com/blog/news/2014/01/the-rtlo-method
